wikipedia_page.main: Catherine 'Kate' Charlotte Maberly (1805 – 7 February 1875) was an Irish writer.

link_mentions.page: Cultural depictions of Henry II of England
response: * Catherine Maberly's 1851 novel The Lady and the Priest is about Henry and his relationships with his mistress Rosamund Clifford, and his antagonist, Thomas à Becket. McGarry, Daniel D., White, Sarah Harriman, Historical Fiction Guide: Annotated Chronological, Geographical, and Topical List of Five Thousand Selected Historical Novels. Scarecrow Press, New York, 1963  (p. 62)
